p.s: Bianca, a friend of mine, volunteered in India to teach children that live in a slum of Delhi englishEnglish grammar at Education Center.
Her day began at 8:30 amante meridiem, she got ready, had breakfast and headed to work around 10 amante meridiem.

Boys and girls are taught sepperatedseparated so from 10:30 amante meridiem to 11:30 amante meridiem or 12 o'clock she taught the boys and after the break from 12:14 to 14 o'clock she did the same with the girls till 4 pmpost meridiem.
She told me about the kids.
They were full of joy and love although their surrounding and conditions were bad, they loved to live.
Bianca always repeats how lovable they were and how this were the best days in her life.
Even if sometimes she was tired and in a bad mood, she still enthuses about her time in India.
These kids brought her real happineshappiness, patience, hope and love.
She is so thankful for beeingbeing able to have this experience in her life.
And is happy to share it.
